1.title: Charge the cops who shot Jacob Blake
1.subtitle: Jacob Blake, 29, was shot by Kenosha, Wisconsin police officers in the back 7 times on August 23, 2020. Officers were on the scene due to a fight, which Jacob Blake was trying to break up. The cops who shot him need to be charged.

1.title: Learn about Julius Jones
1.subtitle: Listen to the Jason Flom & Kim Kardashian West talk about Julius Jones’ story.

2.title: Golde
2.subtitle: We're on a mission to make wellness easy, accessible and fun for all. To us, self-care means feeling like your best self. We believe that being well should feel good. That means products that fit seamlessly into your lifestyle, not the other way around.

products.name: Pure Matcha
products.description: Enjoy the ultimate green superfood in its purest form: matcha, made with 100% pure, shade-grown green tea leaves from Uji, Japan.

products.name: Papaya Bright Face Mask
products.description: This brightening mask is made with 100% pure, edible superfoods. Featuring superfruits like lucuma, papaya, and sea buckthorn berry, it's packed with vitamin C and smells like a tropical vacation.

products.name: Skin Hydration Ade
products.description: Sip + glow to support skin hydration with the power of superfoods.

2.title: Daunte Wright was stopped for expired plates, but driving while Black may have been his 'crime'
2.subtitle: The police confrontation escalated after officers saw what could have been an air freshener hanging illegally from the rearview mirror.

3.title: Code Switch Podcast
3.subtitle: Hosted by journalists of color, our podcast tackles the subject of race head-on. We explore how it impacts every part of society — from politics and pop culture to history, sports and everything in between. This podcast makes ALL OF US part of the conversation — because we're all part of the story.

3.title: Me and White Supremacy
3.subtitle: Based on the viral Instagram challenge that captivated participants worldwide, Me and White Supremacy takes readers on a 28-day journey, complete with journal prompts, to do the necessary and vital work that can ultimately lead to improving race relations.

4.title: The symbols of systemic racism — and how to take away their power
4.subtitle: Multidisciplinary artist and TED Fellow Paul Rucker is unstitching the legacy of systemic racism in the United States. A collector of artifacts connected to the history of slavery — from branding irons and shackles to postcards depicting lynchings — Rucker couldn't find an undamaged Ku Klux Klan robe for his collection, so he began making his own.

4.title: 13th Amendment
4.subtitle: The 13th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution, ratified in 1865 in the aftermath of the Civil War, abolished slavery in the United States.

5.title: QuintesScential Candles
5.subtitle: Since we love burning scented candles, we decided to embark on our journey of becoming Black chandlers. We decided, from the beginning, to use only the healthiest ingredients in anything that we make and sell.

products.name: Earthy
products.description: Earthy is a sensual fragrance that lives up to its name. Our Earthy is aromatic, woodsy, and intoxicating, with a prominent sandalwood base, complemented by layers of sage, spice, and amber.

products.name: Sweet Dreams
products.description: Ready for bed? Time to unwind from a hectic day? Escape with gentle notes of lavender on your pillow with the crisp scent of freshly washed linen.

products.name: Pleasantry
products.description: Our Pleasantry is a proven pleaser, combining a patented odor neutralizing technology with a crisp, clean fragrance that brings to mind fresh linens drying on the line. Pleasantry doesn't just cover up unwanted smells, it cancels them out.

5.title: A Content Analysis and Study of Colorism and Strides toward Inclusivity in the Cosmetic Industry
5.subtitle: The purpose of this research is twofold: 1) to explore colorism in the cosmetic industry in light of multiple marketing venues such as social media, online, and retail stores and 2) to provide a snapshot of improvement (or lack of) in shades and foundation colors offered in the beauty industry.

6.title: Support the King Center
6.subtitle: The King Center remain committed to proactively educating and training individuals and leaders across all sectors in Nonviolence365 to influence equitable change in our national and global infrastructure.

6.title: Vera Institute of Justice
6.subtitle: Vera is powered by hundreds of advocates, researchers, and activists working to transform the criminal legal and immigration systems until they’re fair for all. Founded in 1961 to advocate for alternatives to money bail in New York City, Vera is now a national organization that partners with impacted communities and government leaders for change.

7.title: Big Mama's Sauce
7.subtitle: We believe that to be the best we must use only the best ingredients. This homemade recipe has been the highlight of our family gatherings since at least 2002…honestly Big Mama can’t even remember, that’s how long she been making it! Big Mama never liked store bought sauce and she wanted to serve only the best to her loved ones. So here we are…on the store shelf ironically! Lol…We hope you taste only love and enjoy just as our family has for all of these years!

7.title: How the Negro National League Was Formed | Field of Dreams...Deferred
7.subtitle: The Negro National League debuted 100 years ago with world-class players and legions of fans. Hear how founder Rube Foster formed the league in Part 1 of "Field of Dreams...Deferred," a four-part series from TBS.

8.title: Land Acknowledgement App
8.subtitle: Text the name of a city and state to 855-917-5263 to find out the Indigenous people of that place.

8.title: Bossa Bars
8.subtitle: Energy bars formulated for women perimenopause to post to help support daily nutritional needs and keep that sneaky extra 10 pounds under control!

9.title: Smell Good Spa
9.subtitle: Established in 1998, we are purveyors of aromatic products for women who are making a conscientious change in their personal care products. Our products are the cherry-on-top for women who love to live good, feel good and smell good, wholesomely.

9.title: Cuff
9.subtitle: A platform for creating mature conversations through discussions of love and dating experiences.

10.title: Justice for the Murder of Rayshard Brooks
10.subtitle: Rayshard Brooks, an unarmed, 27 year old Black man was murdered after 3 officers responded to complaints of him sleeping in his vehicle in the Wendy’s parking lot. After struggling with the officers, Brooks began to run for his life, when he was shot in the back more than once.

10.title: Reconstruction in America
10.subtitle: Read the Equal Justice Initiative's report on racial violence after the Civil War, from 1865-1876.

11.title: Iltopia Studios
11.subtitle: Iltopia Studios is a small creative studio based in Portland, Oregon. Our objective is simple: make comics and cartoons that open doors to more understanding. Iltopia Studios is dedicated to producing engaging content to our customers at a high quality and a variety of price points. Founded by creator Steven Christian. His goal is to create quirky adventure stories about the Black experience in America that entertains, empowers, and educates. We make cartoons and comics with emerging technology to provide unique and immersive storytelling experiences.

products.name: Cutie Catcher Pack #1
products.description: This Sticker Pack is collections handcrafted stickers by artist Steven Christian. The designs are based on cartoon and comic Eyelnd Feevr.  All sticker are 4” tall, hand cut, and hand laminated. They are great for placing on laptops, skateboards, water bottles, etc. With all the available designs, there is no limit to where you can place them!

products.name: Black Superheroes Matter Artbook
products.description: Black Superheroes Matter Artbook is the original illustration series by Steven Christian aimed at redefining popular superheroes through the eyes of black children. The book includes 110 full color illustrations ranging from anime to Power Rangers. This quirky collection of illustrations is guaranteed to empower and inspire you to redefine you own heroes in your image. Each book is handmade, numbered, and signed by artist Steven Christian.

products.name: Eyelnd Feevr Season 1: Big City, Small Dreemz
products.description: Big City, Small Dreemz is the first Season in the Eyelnd Feevr Webseries. It introduces us to Roscoe Thomason an intelligent, precocious and rebellious 9-year-old. He explores one of his wildest dreams with his best friend Thomas "T.J." Jenkins. As they try to find the true meaning, one must wonder if this is figment of Roscoe's wild imagination or a foreshadowing of what is to come.

11.title: Double Dutch Dolls
11.subtitle: Through Fashion and Fun encourage young girls to explore and appreciate each other’s differences and similarities. Beauty comes in all shades and the brand seeks to create a community that celebrates the multicultural beauty of every child.

products.name: 18" African American Fashion Doll- Zaria Bradley
products.description: Hi! My name is Zaria Bradley. I am Kaila’s levelheaded, laidback twin-sister. My personal style is "classic cool". I’m into Soccer, Science, and keeping Kaila out of trouble, which is a huge job. I am in the 8th grade at Stylesboro Middle school. I am Captain of the Stingrays soccer team, President of the Science Club. I’ve got my future all planned out with a soccer scholarship, HBCU undergrad and med school.

products.name: 18" African American Fashion Doll- Kaila Bradley
products.description: Hi! My name is Kaila Bradley and I love fashion. I am the creative mind behind the Double Dutch Dolls hip style. A budding fashionista, I design all of our clothes and have plans to launch my own fashion line, named none other than "Double Dutch Dolls" in honor of me and my also fabulous sister, Zaria. I am in the 8th grade at Stylesboro Middle school and Co-captain of the Stingrays Cheerleading team.

products.name: Double Dutch Dolls Book 1- "Double Dare"
products.description: Navigating middle school can be tricky. But, 14-year old twins Kaila and Zaria Bradley, known to everyone as the Double Dutch Dolls, seem to have it all figured out.

12.title: I Wear African
12.subtitle: I Wear African is a campaign initiative created to promote and celebrate the contemporary African lifestyle by bringing the best quality Afrocentric brands to our fans.

products.name: Hector Rectangular Indoor Lumbar Pillow
products.description: Artfully inspiring and beautiful, the Lumbar Pillow bolsters your home instantly and effortlessly while evoking bohemian style. Made in the USA, the classic rectangular silhouette of the pillow is filled with a feather down insert and is covered with a quality linen blend fabric.

products.name: African Print Dashiki T-Shirt White
products.description: The D’iyanu white dashiki t-shirt is perfect for those hot summer days! Stay cool and look great with this dashiki t-shirt which features an ultra soft feel and unique center front and sleeve details. This will become an instant favorite in your closet, and one of your most worn shirts in the hot summer!

products.name: Women African Print Yellow Long Puff Sleeve Dress
products.description: Handmade, 100% cotton, Afronista dress. Available in sizes 2-14.

12.title: Find Your Representatives
12.subtitle: Here you can find your representatives, how to contact them, bills they’ve introduced, committees they serve on, and political contributions they’ve received.

13.title: The History of Mass Incarceration
13.subtitle: From Alexis de Tocqueville to Ronald Reagan, learn more about the forces that have shaped the current state of our prison system.

13.title: Buttaz & Wax
13.subtitle: Buttaz & Wax is a handcrafted body butter and personal care line that came about after founder Keisha Marie made one of her body butters and her eight year old daughter looked up at her and said "mommy these are good, you should sell them".

products.name: Coco Loco Body Butter
products.description: Apply to any area of the body as needed. Best used after a shower when skin is still a bit damp. The butters and oils will lock moisture from shower into your skin.

products.name: Beard Oil
products.description: Work 3-5 drops of our beard oil into your hair revive your beard. Best used right after a shower while your beard is still damp

products.name: Lavender Soap
products.description: Our Lavender handcrafted soap, just like our Lavender bathsalts, smells like calming Lavender.

14.title: African-American Heroism in the Military
14.subtitle: Dating all the way back to the American Revolution, African-Americans have played key roles in the history (and success) of the U.S. military. Profiled below are some notable African-Americans and their achievements, as well as milestones in the integration of African-Americans in the U.S. military.

14.title: Jarvis Boards
14.subtitle: Jarvis Boards' mission has always been to craft paddle boards in Austin, Texas that are environmentally friendly, look great, and perform well. To accomplish this, we employ a wide range of techniques to craft our small-batch production wooden SUPs in our Austin studio.

products.name: Hollow Core Paddle Board Frame Kits
products.description: There is something magical about creating something with your own two hands. Building your own hollow core paddle board will be one of the most rewarding projects that you'll tackle.

products.name: Let's Surf Y'all! Dad hat
products.description: Let's Surf Y'all! Dad hats aren't just for dads. This one's got a low profile with an adjustable strap and curved visor. Available in khaki and light blue.

products.name: Surf Wax Candle
products.description: We teamed up with our friends at Jimbo's Surf Wax to create a unique line of surf wax candles. Each candle is slow cooked over a wood stove in Maine using surf wax and a hint of coconut.

15.title: 11 Black Athletes Who Made Winter Olympic History
15.subtitle: Black Olympic athletes come from a long line of pioneers who made it possible for them to compete and win at the Olympics. And even though the Olympic Games have been around for centuries, there are still Black athletes who become the first to compete in their sport at the Olympics.

15.title: Aloha Glamour
15.subtitle:
Aloha Glamour is a lifestyle movement that promotes women loving themselves wholeheartedly. We are a community of women that empower others to use find and use their voice to turn their tragedies into triumphs and their mess into a message which enables them to build from the inside out...seeing and LIVING in color again. 

Thanks to our inspiring collections and our impeccable customer service, we have been highly successful since day one. Browse through our site and check out the latest additions to our collection, and feel free to get in touch with our team if you need any assistance.

We want you to create a story in each and every Aloha Glamour piece that you wear. What's the color of your story?

16.title: The Green Laundress
16.subtitle: The Green Laundress offers the best laundry products at the lowest prices online.

products.name: Tub Scrub
products.description: Our Tub Scrub will have your tub as well as your whole bathroom sparkling and smelling fresh and clean! 1-2 heaping spoonfuls with a little water is all you need!

products.name: Laundry Soap
products.description: Our 24 ounce bag of Laundry Soap will have your clothes smelling fresh without any lingering artificial fragrances like commercial detergent. Great for those with sensitive skin!

products.name: Multi-Purpose Spray
products.description: There's no mystery in the name! Our 16 ounce Multi Purpose Spray can be used to clean just about anything.

16.title: Criminal Justice Facts
16.subtitle: The Sentencing Project compiles state-level criminal justice data from a variety of sources. Using this state-by-state data feature, you can navigate between interactive maps, tables, and rankings that allow you to access and use these data.

17.title: Dynamic Confluence
17.subtitle: I have items that I carry with me anywhere I go in case of an emergency. I couldn't find an emergency kit that was complete, so I made a few of my own. I hope people will find these items useful. It's better to have and not need, than need and not have.

17.title: Seeing White Podcast Series
17.subtitle: Just what is going on with white people? Police shootings of unarmed African Americans. Acts of domestic terrorism by white supremacists. The renewed embrace of raw, undisguised white-identity politics. Unending racial inequity in schools, housing, criminal justice, and hiring. Some of this feels new, but in truth it’s an old story.

18.title: What Anti-racist Teachers Do Differently
18.subtitle: They view the success of black students as central to the success of their own teaching. Read more from Pirette McKamey, principal of San Francisco’s Mission High School and an anti-racist educator for more than 30 years.

18.title: Derek Chauvin sentencing
18.subtitle: A Hennepin County jury found Derek Chauvin guilty on all three counts against him on Tuesday, April 20, 2021, setting the stage for the sentencing of the former Minneapolis officer. Here's what we know about when sentencing will happen and what to expect.

19.title: Open a random campaign to donate to
19.subtitle: Take the effort of decision out of it — tap here and we'll select a random campaign for you to support!

19.title: Color of Change
19.subtitle: Color Of Change was founded in moments just like this one. As Black communities reeled in grief as all levels of government failed to protect Black people in the wake of Hurricane Katrina, we recognized that not enough of the people and institutions with power over our lives had any fear of disappointing Black people. For the last 15 years, we've focused on building that power.

20.title: As I Am

products.name: Coconut CoWash 16 oz
products.description: You already know it and your hair can feel it! CoWashing is the way to cleanse your hair most of the time. 20.title: Dawoud Bey: The Birmingham Project
20.subtitle: In 2005 American photographer Dawoud Bey visited Birmingham, Alabama, to explore the possibility of making work that would commemorate the September 15, 1963, bombing of the 16th Street Baptist Church. The Birmingham Project, a series that includes photographic diptychs and a split-screen video, is Bey’s powerful response.

21.title: Bamenda Coffee
21.subtitle: Want to have the best coffee beans in Chicago, Illinois? Get them here at Bamenda Coffee, where our coffee comes fresh from the highlands of Bamenda, Africa, and Latin America. We bring you 100% Arabica and Robusta coffee that will surely make you ask for more.

products.name: Green Coffee Beans, 100% Arabica
products.description: During the Process, the fruit part is stripped away and the seed inside is dried to leave raw green coffee beans. The roasted beans are ground and brewed to make our favorite drink.

products.name: The Chicago Dark
products.description: During the Process, the fruit part is stripped away and the seed inside is dried to leave raw green coffee beans. The roasted beans are ground and brewed to make our favorite drink.

products.name: Leshey Towels, "Kitchen Bar Mop" Cleaning towels
products.description: Leshey Towels, "Kitchen Bar Mop" cleaning towels, (12 Pack, 16 x 19) Amazing quality. Pure cotton white towels, restaurant cleaning towels, "shop towels" and rags - Bulk "Bar mops towels" set.

22.title: CarmaBella Skincare

products.name: Brightening Turmeric Clay Mask

products.name: HydroSurge Moisturizing Gel

products.description: The Essential Bath & Body Set is a nourishing collection that will leave your skin feeling soft and moisturized all day. This set includes the Natural Sugar Based Body Wash, a bath puff, and the Nourishing Shea Body Lotion.

products.name: McBride Sisters Collection Black Girl Magic 2018 California Merlot
products.description: This juicy and sensational wine is a classic Merlot, sophisticated for the wine connoisseur and delicious for the wine novices.

products.name: McBride Sisters Collection Black Girl Magic NV New Zealand Sparkling Brut

products.name: SHE CAN 4-Pack Sampler
products.description: Yes SHE CAN have it all! Enjoy our most popular sampler including one of each flavor. Four cans is the equivalent of two bottles of wine and an amazing value for these delicious wines and spritzers.

23.title: Racial Literacy: What Does it Mean?
23.subtitle: What is your first memory of racial difference? Unfortunately, our education system doesn’t include a standard explanation to our young people of the history of the creation of the concept of race (or critical race theory). Learn today what you should've in school.

24.title: Controversy over Confederate monuments is overdue
24.subtitle: As Confederate monuments and memorials are toppled across the United States, Stanford historian James T. Campbell says it is important to think historically not only about the past but also about our own time and what future generations might say about us.

24.title: Juneteenth is a federal holiday. What comes next?
24.subtitle: As President Biden signed the Juneteenth National Independence Day Act into law, he acknowledged a current struggle for voting rights.

25.title: Color blind or color brave?
25.subtitle: The subject of race can be very touchy. As finance executive Mellody Hobson says, it's a "conversational third rail." But, she says, that's exactly why we need to start talking about it. In this engaging, persuasive talk, Hobson makes the case that speaking openly about race — and particularly about diversity in hiring — makes for better businesses and a better society.

25.title: Doe Wiz Apparel
25.subtitle: Doe Wiz apparel was found by Kamar Doe Wiz Lewis. The term Doe came about from the street meaning "Money," and the term "Wiz" short for wisdom. By combining the two terms, we have the name "Doe Wiz" which means "A smart way to get money."

products.name: DWA Cream or White Hoodie
products.description: Casual spot pullover hoodie - loose fit. Choosing this stylish pull over hoodie will add comfort good for exercise, fitness, workout, running, jogging, sportswear etc.

products.name: DWA Grape Purple Yellow Cropped Top Set
products.description: Casual sport sweat suit round neck pullover top long pants, loose fit. Choosing this stylish two-piece suit will make you more attractive. Suit casual, exercise, fitness, workout, running, jogging, sportswear etc.

products.name: DWA Varsity Set Red
products.description: Snap closure. Contrast sleeves. Knitted collar, cuffs and waistband with stripe details. Press-stud closure. Contrast studs. Hidden ear phone loops.

26.title: Oh-Mazing!
26.subtitle: Yes, we sell granola (it's quite tasty), but more importantly, we want to inspire you to live your life with purpose, passion, and to follow your dreams. Our products are here to bring the adventure back to snacking, and better yet, celebrate YOU when those dreams are achieved.

products.name: Original Recipe
products.description: The Original Recipe blend has a sweet caramel flavor that makes it simply delicious. There are so many ways to enjoy this treat--topping on your yogurt, adding some crunch to your favorite ice cream, or creating a crust for a cheesecake.

products.name: Lemon Bar
products.description: Lemon Bar will please the palate of all lemon lovers and add a refreshing flavor to a bowl of oatmeal or a new bite to your favorite cheesecake recipe.

products.name: Caribbean Delight
products.description: Caribbean Delight is our first vegan product. The ingredients include coconut oil, grated coconut, and a touch of raisins that will make your palate dance. Not to mention, you will immediately be reminded of that time you went on an island vacation.

26.title: Hiram Rhodes Revels - Biography
26.subtitle: A freeman his entire life, Hiram Rhodes Revels was the first African American to serve in the U.S. Congress. With his moderate political orientation and oratorical skills honed from years as a preacher, Revels filled a vacant seat in the United States Senate in 1870.

27.title: Sweet Pea Books Inc
27.subtitle: Sweet Pea Books is dedicated to producing multicultural books that expose, inspire, amuse, and foster a love of reading in all children. Sweet Pea Books aims to promote the development of good character by teaching values through literature as well as expose young readers to different cultures.

products.name: D Is For Dragon Fruit (Hardcover)
products.description: D is for Dragon Fruit is a vibrantly illustrated, exotic fruit alphabet book that exposes children to a variety of nutritious fruits, reinforces the alphabet and expands a child’s knowledge of the world.

products.name: When Mama Braids My Hair (Hardcover)
products.description: When Mama Braids My Hair captures a young girl’s experience of having her hair braided and the bond it creates with her mother. The tradition of African hair braiding is more than just a Sunday routine. Come join Nikki on an adventure as she is transformed into an Egyptian queen, a Nigerian goddess, a Zulu warrior, and a Maasai girl.

products.name: Elephants Don't Have Stripes! (COMING SOON!)
products.description: Elephants Don’t Have Stripes! Deep in the valley, in the dry grasslands of the African savanna, a young elephant admires other animals for their beauty. He yearns to look and act more like them. One by one, each wish comes true and the young elephant couldn’t be happier.

27.title: What Happened on May 25th?
27.subtitle: On May 25th, 2020, George Floyd was in Minneapolis on business, far from his family and community, when four Minneapolis police officers murdered him in broad daylight. It was a modern day lynching as those police officers served as judge, jury, and executioner on an unarmed, non-violent, handcuffed Black man.

29.title: Covid-19’s Impact on People in Prison
29.subtitle: People who are incarcerated are at great risk of sickness and death as a result of the Covid-19 pandemic and more must be done to release people who are imprisoned and are not a threat to public safety or are elderly or infirm.

29.title: Here Are the 18 African-American Astronauts
29.subtitle: It was 22 years after Alan Shepard’s first space trip that the U.S. sent a person of color up.

30.title: StepStitches

products.name: Black Rag Doll - Raggedy Ann Doll

31.title: The Costs of Racism to White People
31.subtitle: We tend to think of racism as a problem for people of color and something we should be concerned about for their sake. However, the costs of racism to white people are devastating, especially to those of us without the money and power to buffer their effects.
